item.title: Report X-2023081489
item.description:
Report X-2023081489

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN AT BAY 14 IN THE NORTH PRIMARY WITH SPILL CART AND FULL PPE AND RESPONDED TO THE SPILL. RESPONDER DISCOVERED A 5 GALLON BUCKET WITH A CORROSIVE 8 STICKER ON THE SIDE AND LIQUID PRESENT AT THE TOP FOLLOWING THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET HE CONTAINERIZED THE SPILL AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. THE SEAL OF THE 5 GALLON BUCKET WAS NOT FULLY ON THE LID CAUSING A GAP

item.description:
Report X-2023080782

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The Flammable Liquid plastic container was processed and discovered in front of the haz cage and placed inside a tote to prevent further leakage. The container may have impacted with another package that may have had a small sharp object inside. DescribePack: Small pin size hole on bottom of container DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside tote and under the hood in the haz cage

item.title: Report X-2023080758
item.description:
Report X-2023080758

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found after being unloaded from facility 659. Package was found to be wet and had Flammable Liquid HazMat labeling. Package was immediately taken out of the load areas and isolated from the rest of the staff. DescribePack: 1 of the 4 plastic bottles inside was leaking out of its cap. Upon further investigation the cap was also found to not have a seal underneath, which caused the leak. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat Cage for isolation and processing.

  • Description: 1. X-2023080740 SequenceEvent: This package was located by loadside 4. the bar code was started to fade. The package contained a strong odor DescribePack: loose cap/valve DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: bag and tote. the tote was placed under a vented hood. 2. X-2023080742 SequenceEvent: This package was located on load side. the manager noticed a strong odor from the package. the bar code was starting to fade as well DescribePack: loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: bag and tote. the tote was placed under the hood

item.title: Report E-2023080771
item.description:
Report E-2023080771

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 8, 2023, four (4) 1-gallon pails of UN2735 were crushed during transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the spill and worked them in using hand tools. After utilizing a degreasing solution and absorbent pads, all waste was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon overpack for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080602
item.description:
Report E-2023080602

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 4, 2023 ,one (1) 1-gallon drum of sodium hydroxide was mishandled by an operator and released approximately one (1) gallon to the concrete floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed neutralizing absorbents to the sodium hydroxide-impacted floor and swept them in with hand tools. Crews utilized hand tools to cut up the impacted pallet, and then proceeded to place the undamaged freight on another pallet. All spent absorbents, the empty container, the cut-up pallet, and miscellaneous cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2023080600
item.description:
Report E-2023080600

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 3, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2810 was crushed during transit and released less than one (<1) gallon of product to the top of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted surface. Crews observed that the drum was not damaged and the release only impacted the top of the drum and was dried up. EWI personnel tightened the bungs on the drum and demobilized.

Report X-2023080671

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FELL OFF THE IC BELT DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS. PACKAGE WAS THEN MOVED INTO A HAZMAT BIN AND MOVED THE HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: THE CAP POPPED OFF THE TOP OF 1 BOTTLE WHEN THE PACKAGE FELL TO THE FLOOR. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS MOVED INTO A HAZMAT BIN AND MOVED THE HAZMAT CAGE.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and hat one of the metal 5 gallon can of petroleum ether (un1268) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 2 quarts of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023080571
item.description:
Report E-2023080571

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: ROCK ISLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of seafoam (un1993) had been damaged by other freight and that one of the inner metal 1 gallon can had its lid pop off and had released 1 gallon of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
